reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Overall objective of the project is to strengthen the engagement among the general public towards the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. As a result at least 5% of reached EU citizens will change their ways into more sustainable direction. This objec tive will be realized though activities that improve the quality of development communications and global education.FRAME VOICE REPORT builds the capacity of CSOs in the set partner countries through training and peer learning activities. During the projec t period of three years two learning processes are carried out to which small and middle-sized CSOs are selected to participate in each project country. These organisations are offered financial support to implement the above-mentioned quality tools in the ir global education and development communication work. The budget for these small-scale projects is 5000?60.000 euros and they last for the maximum of one year. The total budget for sub granting in Finland is 875 000 euros. In Finland an estimated 35 CSOs will participate in this project in three years. Participation does not require membership in Kepa. The project is implemented simultaneously in seven EU countries (Finland Denmark Netherlands Belgium France Spain and Italy). The partners include; CISU - Civil Society in Development (DK project lead) Wilde Ganzen (NL) RESACOOP (FR) COP - Consorzio Ong Piemontesi (IT) and Lafede.cat ? Organizatcions per la Justicia Global (ES). An international project team works closely together during the project and shar es relevant information about new ideas and learning experiences regarding quality work in different parts of Europe. The starting date of the project is 1st of December 2017.
